intro: Psacalium matudae, commonly known as the Matudae's psacalium, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
